trans-unit.source:
\n

An average counter that shows how many items are processed, on average, during an operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: Counters of this type display a ratio of the items processed to the number of operations completed.
trans-unit.target: Xxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxx x xxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The ratio is calculated by comparing the number of items processed during the last interval to the number of operations completed during the last interval.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An average counter that measures the time it takes, on average, to complete a process or operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxx$ xx xxxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxxx x xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: Counters of this type display a ratio of the total elapsed time of the sample interval to the number of processes or operations completed during that time.
trans-unit.target: Xxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxx x xxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
This counter type measures time in ticks of the system clock.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A difference counter that shows the change in the measured attribute between the two most recent sample intervals.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A difference counter that shows the change in the measured attribute between the two most recent sample intervals.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
It is the same as the CounterDelta32 counter type except that is uses larger fields to accomodate larger values.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xx xx xxx xxxx xx xxx $xxxxxx$XxxxxxxXxxxx00$$xxxxxx$ xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A base counter that indicates the number of items sampled.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: It is used as the denominator in the calculations to get an average among the items sampled when taking timings of multiple, but similar items.
trans-unit.target: Xx xx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
Used with CounterMultiTimer, CounterMultiTimerInverse, CounterMultiTimer100Ns, and CounterMultiTimer100NsInverse.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxx $xxxxxx$XxxxxxxXxxxxXxxxx$$xxxxxx$$ $xxxxxx$XxxxxxxXxxxxXxxxxXxxxxxx$$xxxxxx$$ $xxxxxx$XxxxxxxXxxxxXxxxx000Xx$$xxxxxx$$ xxx $xxxxxx$XxxxxxxXxxxxXxxxx000XxXxxxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A percentage counter that displays the active time of one or more components as a percentage of the total time of the sample interval.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
Because the numerator records the active time of components operating simultaneously, the resulting percentage can exceed 100 percent.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx 000 xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A percentage counter that shows the active time of one or more components as a percentage of the total time of the sample interval.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
It measures time in 100 nanosecond (ns) units.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xx xxxxxxxx xxxx xx 000 xxxxxxxxxx $xx$ xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A percentage counter that shows the active time of one or more components as a percentage of the total time of the sample interval.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: Counters of this type measure time in 100 nanosecond (ns) units.
trans-unit.target: Xxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx 000 xxxxxxxxxx $xx$ xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
They derive the active time by measuring the time that the components were not active and subtracting the result from multiplying 100 percent by the number of objects monitored.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx 000 xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A percentage counter that shows the active time of one or more components as a percentage of the total time of the sample interval.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
It derives the active time by measuring the time that the components were not active and subtracting the result from 100 percent by the number of objects monitored.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx 000 xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A percentage counter that shows the average time that a component is active as a percentage of the total sample time.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxx x xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A percentage counter that displays the average percentage of active time observed during sample interval.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The value of these counters is calculated by monitoring the percentage of time that the service was inactive and then subtracting that value from 100 percent.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxxx 000 xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An average counter designed to monitor the average length of a queue to a resource over time.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx x xxxxx xx x xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source: It shows the difference between the queue lengths observed during the last two sample intervals divided by the duration of the interval.
trans-unit.target: Xx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
This type of counter is typically used to track the number of items that are queued or waiting.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An average counter that monitors the average length of a queue to a resource over time.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx x xxxxx xx x xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source: Counters of this type display the difference between the queue lengths observed during the last two sample intervals, divided by the duration of the interval.
trans-unit.target: Xxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: This counter type is the same as CountPerTimeInterval32 except that it uses larger fields to accommodate larger values.
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxx xx $xxxxxx$XxxxxXxxXxxxXxxxxxxx00$$xxxxxx$ xxxxxx xxxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
This type of counter is typically used to track a high-volume or very large number of items that are queued or waiting.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxx x xxxx$xxxxxx xx xxxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A difference timer that shows the total time between when the component or process started and the time when this value is calculated.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An instantaneous counter that shows the most recently observed value.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
Used, for example, to maintain a simple count of items or operations.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx$ xxx xxxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxxx x xxxxxx xxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An instantaneous counter that shows the most recently observed value.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source: Used, for example, to maintain a simple count of a very large number of items or operations.
trans-unit.target: Xxxx$ xxx xxxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxxx x xxxxxx xxxxx xx x xxxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
It is the same as NumberOfItems32 except that it uses larger fields to accommodate larger values.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xx xx xxx xxxx xx $xxxxxx$XxxxxxXxXxxxx00$$xxxxxx$ xxxxxx xxxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An instantaneous counter that shows the most recently observed value in hexadecimal format.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
Used, for example, to maintain a simple count of items or operations.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx$ xxx xxxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxxx x xxxxxx xxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An instantaneous counter that shows the most recently observed value.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source: Used, for example, to maintain a simple count of a very large number of items or operations.
trans-unit.target: Xxxx$ xxx xxxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxxx x xxxxxx xxxxx xx x xxxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
It is the same as NumberOfItemsHEX32 except that it uses larger fields to accommodate larger values.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xx xx xxx xxxx xx $xxxxxx$XxxxxxXxXxxxxXXX00$$xxxxxx$ xxxxxx xxxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A difference counter that shows the average number of operations completed during each second of the sample interval.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
Counters of this type measure time in ticks of the system clock.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A difference counter that shows the average number of operations completed during each second of the sample interval.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: Counters of this type measure time in ticks of the system clock.
trans-unit.target: Xxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
This counter type is the same as the RateOfCountsPerSecond32 type, but it uses larger fields to accommodate larger values to track a high-volume number of items or operations per second, such as a byte-transmission rate.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxx xx xxx $xxxxxx$XxxxXxXxxxxxXxxXxxxxx00$$xxxxxx$ xxxx$ xxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx x xxxx$xxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx$ xxxx xx x xxxx$xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A base counter that stores the denominator of a counter that presents a general arithmetic fraction.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx x xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
Check that this value is greater than zero before using it as the denominator in a RawFraction value calculation.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxxx xxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xx x $xxxxxx$XxxXxxxxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An instantaneous percentage counter that shows the ratio of a subset to its set as a percentage.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxx xx x xxxxxx xx xxx xxx xx x xxxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: For example, it compares the number of bytes in use on a disk to the total number of bytes on the disk.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xx x xxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
Counters of this type display the current percentage only, not an average over time.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx$ xxx xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A base counter that stores the number of sampling interrupts taken and is used as a denominator in the sampling fraction.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxx xx x xxxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: The sampling fraction is the number of samples that were 1 (or true) for a sample interrupt.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxx 0 $xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$$ xxx x xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
Check that this value is greater than zero before using it as the denominator in a calculation of SampleFraction.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxxx xxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxxxx xx $xxxxxx$XxxxxxXxxxxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An average counter that shows the average number of operations completed in one second.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: When a counter of this type samples the data, each sampling interrupt returns one or zero.
trans-unit.target: Xxxx x xxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxx$ xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xx xxxx.

trans-unit.source: The counter data is the number of ones that were sampled.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
It measures time in units of ticks of the system performance timer.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xx xxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A percentage counter that shows the average ratio of hits to all operations during the last two sample intervals.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A percentage counter that shows the active time of a component as a percentage of the total elapsed time of the sample interval.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xx x xxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: It measures time in units of 100 nanoseconds (ns).
trans-unit.target: Xx xxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxx xx 000 xxxxxxxxxxx $xx$.

trans-unit.source:
Counters of this type are designed to measure the activity of one component at a time.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx x xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A percentage counter that shows the average percentage of active time observed during the sample interval.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x
